K.J.A. Wishnia

Red House

Part of " Filomena Buscarsela " series

"Red House" by K.J.A. Wishnia is a gripping and atmospheric novel that explores the dark underbelly of contemporary Japan. The story follows the life of a young American woman, Emily, who moves to Japan to teach English and escape her troubled past. However, she soon finds herself drawn into the world of Yakuza, the Japanese mafia, when she begins a relationship with a charming and enigmatic gangster, Kenji. As Emily becomes more entangled in Kenji's world, she discovers that his boss, the feared and powerful Kizaki, has a dangerous obsession with her. Kizaki believes that Emily is the reincarnation of his long-lost love, and he will stop at nothing to have her for himself. Emily must navigate the treacherous waters of the Yakuza underworld, all while trying to maintain her sanity and her life. Wishnia's writing is sharp and evocative, bringing the streets of Tokyo and the insular world of the Yakuza to life in vivid detail. The characters are complex and well-drawn, with Emily's growing desperation and fear palpable on the page. The novel also delves into the darker aspects of Japanese culture, including the role of women and the rigid social hierarchies that exist within the Yakuza. Overall, "Red House" is a thrilling and suspenseful read that will keep readers on the edge of their seats. It is a powerful exploration of obsession, identity, and the consequences of our choices. Fans of crime fiction and Japanese culture will find much to love in this gripping novel.
